Review: The ending is ridiculous and drags, but still this is a heartwarming romance. Nani is incredible as usual, easily the best actor out of all the big stars.

Sleep as death, waking as rebirth. Like an Afternoon Dream (English translation), plays out almost entirely in static wide shots. Gives the film the feeling of being stage-like while also feeling very slice-of-life.
Not at all what I expected. A very impressive debut from Ganesh K. Babu with a great album from Jen Martin.
Easily SK’s best film. Really good action choreo in this as well as visuals. The overall message is par for the course, but it’s delivered it in a interesting way.

Review: *Minor Structural Spoilers*"There is nothing new left to be written. Hold your pen firmly, and what is meant to be will be written".Some thoughts: - A film about not only filmmaking but the power of artistry in general.- A remarkable achievement in this day and age of commercial Tamil movies. Karthik Subbaraj pulls his classic bait-and-switch here, but he applies it to the common 1st and 2nd half structure of the film itself.- SJ Suryah is…

Review: May have entered the canon of my favorite comedies. This works so well on multiple fronts: a black comedy, a thriller, and a masala film. As far as comedies go, I think this crosses cultures pretty well.

Grew in stature in my mind several days after watching it. Would prefer if it was stopped being pitched as an action film, instead it's more of a hangout/romance movie with 2 incredible action sequences. Although I suppose it's a movie literally about the consequences that follow our actions (ie getting into fisticuffs).
If it's possible to give an award for overdirecting then Mysskin deserves it for this.
